head.supplied: VICTORIAN RAILWAYS ¶ Melb Goods ¶ Station ¶ 12th July ¶ 186 ¶ 6 ¶ [Sout]h Geelong ¶ Received for conveyance ¶ 24/7/66 ¶ the abovenamed Goods, subject to the conditions on the other side, and in pay...

div.p: P67/474, unit 381, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS annotated 'No 70' of 74 receipts covering materials supplied via the Botanic Garden for the Intercolonial Exhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7, for which M was one of the Commissioners.

div.p: Received for conveyance 24/7/66 the abovenamed Goods, subject to the conditions on the other side, and in payment for same the sum of — pounds 6 shillings, and 3 pence.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
[…]
signature illegible.
For the Victorian Railways
